title: Light sources

properties.name: description
properties.value: Light sources are used to illuminate dark caves and dungeons. Some of these areas are inaccessible or very dangerous without a light source.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Light sources

Light sources are used to illuminate dark caves and dungeons. Some of these areas are inaccessible or very dangerous without a light source.

Most light sources are items that require certain Firemaking levels to be lit. However, there are also certain equipable and stationary light sources.

Contents

  • 1 Consequences of no light
  • 2 Dark areas
    • 2.1 Light source required
    • 2.2 Light source optional
  • 3 Ignition
  • 4 Extinguishing
  • 5 Gas explosions
  • 6 Light sources
  • 7 Trivia
  • 8 Changes

Consequences of no light[edit | edit source]

Main article: Darkness

After spending 9 seconds in a dark area without light source, there will be a warning message and after 18 seconds (30 ticks), the message "Tiny biting insects swarm all over you!" is displayed in the chatbox. Starting with that message, 1 damage per tick will be dealt in quick succession, which cannot be blocked with protection prayers. The damage will stop upon leaving the dark area or igniting a light source.

Note: The 18 seconds timer can be reset by logging out, however, it is not possible to log out after being damaged, as it is considered in-combat.

Players cannot attack without a light source in dark areas but can still be attacked.

Dark areas[edit | edit source]

Light source required[edit | edit source]

  • Abandoned Mine
  • Dorgesh-Kaan South Dungeon
  • Dorgesh-Kaan mine
  • Falador Mole Lair
  • The genie's cavern west of Nardah
  • Kruk's Dungeon
  • Lumbridge Swamp Caves
  • Mos Le'Harmless Cave
  • Shayzien Crypts
  • Skavid Caves
  • Sophanem Dungeon
  • Temple of Ikov dungeon lower level

Light source optional[edit | edit source]

  • Chasm of Tears
  • Crombwick Manor
  • Slayer Tower basement

Ignition[edit | edit source]

Unlit light sources may be lit by using a tinderbox on them. Torches may also be lit with dry sticks. Each lightable item has a certain Firemaking level requirement to be lit. Players may use spicy stews to boost their level with up to 5.

Empty oil lamps, empty oil lanterns and empty bullseye lanterns have to be filled with lamp oil before they can be lit. Lamp oil is made by distilling swamp tar at either the lamp oil still in the Chemist's house in Rimmington, or the lamp still next to Miltog in Dorgesh-Kaan.

Extinguishing[edit | edit source]

Light sources that have been lit can be extinguished at any time by the player, unless it is the only light source in a dark area. Some light sources can also forcibly be extinguished by several monsters and environmental effects:

  • Scarab mages can occasionally have all extinguishable light sources go out (Your lights have been magically extinguished.).
  • The giant mole might extinguish any candles, torches, or oil lamps when it digs away.
  • In the Sophanem Dungeon, falling into a scarab trap puts out every extinguishable light source.
  • Gas explosions will extinguish candles, torches, and oil lamps while dealing damage to the player.
  • Falling into water will douse all extinguishable light sources.

Gas explosions[edit | edit source]

The areas where gas explosions can occur in the Lumbridge Swamp Caves.

Torches, candles and oil lamps will cause gas explosions in certain areas of the Lumbridge Swamp Caves, as the flames are exposed to the gas.

Upon entering such area with one of these light sources, a message is displayed in the chat box; "Your [light source] flares brightly!". After roughly 4.2 seconds (7 ticks) in the area, a gas explosion occurs, dealing 25% of your total Hitpoints in damage. The light source will then also be extinguished.

Constructing the Fire of Eternal Light (after the Making Friends with My Arm quest) in the swamp caves will disable gas explosions. It also functions as a light source throughout the caves.

Light sources[edit | edit source]

Certain light sources do not have to be ignited, and may be equipped.

Each light source has a different level of brightness, which only visually changes how illuminated a dark area will be. There are three levels of brightness, and these will stack (for example, the brightness of three candles is equivalent to the brightness of one bullseye lantern).

Item level
required 		Brightness Ignites gas Extinguishable
by effects 		Notes
Torch 1 1 Yes Yes Can be lit with dry sticks, even in the water-filled chamber of the Haunted Mine.
Candle 1 1 Yes Yes
Black candle 1 1 Yes Yes Obtainable only during the Merlin's Crystal quest
White candle lantern 4 1 No Yes
Black candle lantern 4 1 No Yes
Oil lamp 12 2 Yes Yes
Oil Lantern 26 2 No Yes
Bullseye Lantern 49 3 No No
Sapphire lantern 49 2 No No Created adding a sapphire to a bullseye lantern. Used in the Tears of Guthix quest.
Emerald lantern 49 3 No No Created adding a emerald lens to a bullseye lantern. Used in the Lunar Diplomacy quest.
Mining Helmet 65 2 No No Equippable.
Fire of Eternal Light 66 3 No N/A Completion of Making Friends With My Arm quest and 35 Construction(boostable) required.
Permanent effects when built in: Falador Mole Lair, Lumbridge Swamp Caves, Mos Le'Harmless Cave.
Firemaking cape 99 3 No N/A Equippable. Requires 99 Firemaking to be bought.
Max cape 99 3 No N/A Equippable. Requires 99 levels in all skills to be bought.
Any Kandarin headgear N/A 2 No N/A Equippable. Requires completion of at least the Kandarin easy diary.
Bruma torch N/A 2 No N/A Equippable. Obtainable as possible reward from Wintertodt.
Glowing fungus N/A Unknown N/A N/A Only obtainable in the Abandoned Mine. Disintegrates if dropped or brought outside.
Abyssal lantern 1 3 No Unknown Equippable. Obtainable as a reward from Guardians of the Rift.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • The bug lantern is not a light source despite its name. Its only use is for Slayer to kill Harpie Bug Swarms.
  • Combining multiple light sources increases the brightness, however a brightness level above 3 makes no difference.
  • Dungeons that require a light source are the only locations where it is possible to adjust the lighting without changing graphics options, a possible use for videomaking.
  • The city of Dorgesh-Kaan is kept alight by hundreds of magical lamps. Their lamps often break, which the player can repair with a light orbs for Firemaking experience, but the brightness level never goes down.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
22 September 2021
(update)

If your light source is inextinguishable, you’ll no longer get the extinguish warning when entering a dark area.

26 August 2020
(update)

Warning messages have been made more prominent when a light source is about to explode due to swamp gas.

v • d • e

  • Lit
  • Black
  • Lit black

  • Lit
  • Bruma torch

  • White candle
  • Lit white candle
  • Black candle
  • Lit black candle

  • Empty
  • Unlit
  • Lit
Oil lanterns
  • Frame
  • Empty
  • Unlit
  • Lit
Bullseye lanterns
Normal
  • Lantern lens
  • Unfinished
  • Empty
  • Unlit
  • Lit
Sapphire
  • Empty sapphire
  • Unlit sapphire
  • Lit sapphire
Emerald
  • Emerald lens
  • Empty emerald
  • Unlit emerald
  • Lit emerald
Clothing
  • Mining helmet
  • Mining helmet (lit)
  • Kandarin headgear 1
  • Kandarin headgear 2
  • Kandarin headgear 3
  • Kandarin headgear 4
  • Firemaking cape

{{External|rs}} '''Light sources''' are used to illuminate [[darkness|dark]] caves and [[dungeons]]. Some of these areas are inaccessible or very dangerous without a light source. Most light sources are items that require certain {{SCP|Firemaking|link=yes}} levels to be lit. However, there are also certain equipable and stationary light sources. ==Consequences of no light== {{Main|Darkness}} After spending 9 seconds in a dark area without light source, there will be a warning message and after 18 seconds (30 ticks), the message ''{{Colour|red|"Tiny biting insects swarm all over you!"|}}'' is displayed in the chatbox. Starting with that message, 1 damage per [[tick]] will be dealt in quick succession, which cannot be blocked with [[protection prayers]]. The damage will stop upon leaving the dark area or igniting a light source. '''Note:''' The 18 seconds timer can be reset by logging out, however, it is not possible to log out after being damaged, as it is considered in-combat. Players cannot attack without a light source in dark areas but can still be attacked. ==Dark areas== ===Light source required=== *[[Abandoned Mine]] *[[Dorgesh-Kaan South Dungeon]] *[[Dorgesh-Kaan mine]] *[[Falador Mole Lair]] *The [[Genie (Spirits of the Elid)|genie's]] cavern west of [[Nardah]] *[[Kruk's Dungeon]] *[[Lumbridge Swamp Caves]] *[[Mos Le'Harmless Cave]] *[[Shayzien Crypts]] *[[Skavid Caves]] *[[Sophanem Dungeon]] *[[Temple of Ikov (dungeon)|Temple of Ikov dungeon]] lower level ===Light source optional=== *[[Chasm of Tears]] *[[Crombwick Manor]] *[[Slayer Tower]] basement ==Ignition== Unlit light sources may be lit by ''using'' a [[tinderbox]] on them. [[Torch]]es may also be lit with [[dry sticks]]. Each lightable item has a certain {{SCP|Firemaking|link=yes}} level requirement to be lit. Players may use [[spicy stew]]s to boost their level with up to 5. [[Empty oil lamp]]s, [[empty oil lantern]]s and [[empty bullseye lantern]]s have to be filled with [[lamp oil]] before they can be lit. Lamp oil is made by distilling [[swamp tar]] at either the [[lamp oil still]] in the [[Chemist's house]] in [[Rimmington]], or the [[lamp still]] next to [[Miltog]] in [[Dorgesh-Kaan]]. ==Extinguishing== Light sources that have been lit can be ''extinguished'' at any time by the player, unless it is the only light source in a dark area. Some light sources can also forcibly be extinguished by several monsters and environmental effects: *[[Scarab mage]]s can occasionally have all extinguishable light sources go out (''Your lights have been magically extinguished.''). *The [[giant mole]] might extinguish any [[candle]]s, [[torch]]es, or [[oil lamp]]s when it digs away. *In the [[Sophanem Dungeon]], falling into a scarab trap puts out every extinguishable light source. *Gas explosions will extinguish [[candle]]s, [[torch]]es, and [[oil lamp]]s while dealing damage to the player. *Falling into water will douse all extinguishable light sources. ==Gas explosions== [[File:Lumbridge swamp caves hazards.png|thumb|right|The areas where gas explosions can occur in the Lumbridge Swamp Caves.]] [[Torch]]es, [[candle]]s and [[oil lamp]]s will cause gas explosions in certain areas of the [[Lumbridge Swamp Caves]], as the flames are exposed to the gas. Upon entering such area with one of these light sources, a message is displayed in the chat box; ''{{Colour|red|"Your [light source] flares brightly!"|}}''. After roughly 4.2 seconds (7 ticks) in the area, a gas explosion occurs, dealing 25% of your total [[Hitpoints]] in damage. The light source will then also be extinguished. Constructing the [[Fire of Eternal Light]] (after the [[Making Friends with My Arm]] quest) in the swamp caves will disable gas explosions. It also functions as a light source throughout the caves. ==Light sources== Certain light sources do not have to be ignited, and may be equipped. Each light source has a different level of brightness, which only visually changes how illuminated a dark area will be. There are three levels of brightness, and these will stack (for example, the brightness of three [[candles]] is equivalent to the brightness of one [[bullseye lantern]]). {|class="wikitable sortable" !colspan="2"|Item !{{SCP|Firemaking}} level

Obtainable as a reward from [[Guardians of the Rift]]. |- |} ==Trivia== *The [[bug lantern]] is not a light source despite its name. Its only use is for [[Slayer]] to kill [[Harpie Bug Swarm]]s. *Combining multiple light sources increases the brightness, however a brightness level above 3 makes no difference. *[[Dungeon]]s that require a light source are the only locations where it is possible to adjust the lighting without changing graphics options, a possible use for videomaking. *The city of [[Dorgesh-Kaan]] is kept alight by hundreds of magical lamps. Their lamps often break, which the player can repair with a [[light orb]]s for [[Firemaking]] [[experience]], but the brightness level never goes down. ==Changes== {{Subject changes header}} {{Subject changes |date = 22 September 2021 |update = Wilderness & Equipment Rebalance Changes |change = If your light source is inextinguishable, you’ll no longer get the extinguish warning when entering a dark area. }} {{Subject changes |date = 26 August 2020 |update = Mahogany Homes |change = Warning messages have been made more prominent when a light source is about to explode due to swamp gas. }} {{Subject changes footer}} {{Light sources}}
